info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:34PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Broome, southwestern Delaware, northeastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Susquehanna Depot, or 13 miles southwest of Deposit, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Susquehanna, Deposit, Susquehanna Depot, Lanesboro, Starrucca, Hiawatha, Starruca, Sherman, Stilesville and Hickory Grove. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 82 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
